flashcards.description: # Given a positive integer n written as abcd... (a, b, c, d... being digits) and a positive integer p we want to find a positive integer k, if it exists, such that the sum of the digits of n taken to the successive powers of p is equal to k * n.

Your task is to sort a given string. Each word in the string will contain a single number. This number is the position the word should have in the result.
